intro: Sida abadiana, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Sida abadiana is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
